documentType: prison incident report and staff memoranda
summary: This document is a Bureau of Prisons Form 583 Report of Incident and accompanying staff memoranda detailing the events of July 23, 2019, at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. It records the discovery of inmate Jeffrey Epstein in his cell with an orange cloth around his neck, initially treated as a suicide attempt. The report includes conflicting accounts from Epstein and his cellmate, Nicholas Tartaglione, with Epstein later alleging Tartaglione tried to kill him and extort money. This document contains Bureau of Prisons records from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, primarily detailing the events of July 23, 2019, when inmate Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell with a rope around his neck. It includes staff shift logs, medical encounter reports for Epstein and his cellmate Nicholas Tartaglione, photo sheets documenting the incident, an administrative detention order for Epstein, and an incident report classifying the event as 'Self-Mutilation'.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary inmate involved in the reported incident. Found in his cell with an orange cloth around his neck, initially reported as a suicide attempt. Later alleged his cellmate tried to kill and extort him.

persons.name: Nicholas Tartaglione
persons.context: Epstein's cellmate. Initially reported finding Epstein and calling for guards. Later accused by Epstein of attempted murder and extortion. Provided his own account of the events.

persons.name: Officer P
persons.context: A staff member who spoke with Epstein after the incident and relayed Epstein's allegations against Tartaglione to the lieutenant.

persons.name: Officer Sat
persons.context: An officer who informed responding staff that Epstein had attempted to hang himself.

persons.name: Dr. [Redacted]
persons.context: Duty medical doctor who was notified and briefed about the incident. Determined no further medical attention was needed at that time.

persons.name: MLP [Redacted]
persons.context: Medical staff who later examined and treated Epstein for marks on his neck and knee.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: The primary inmate subject of the documents. He was found unresponsive in his cell (SHU Z05-Cell 124) with a rope around his neck on July 23, 2019, at approximately 1:27 AM. Medical reports document his injuries and his placement on suicide watch.

persons.name: Nicholas John Tartaglione
persons.context: Epstein's cellmate in SHU cell 124. He was at the cell door when staff arrived in response to the incident on July 23, 2019. He was secured and removed from the cell. A medical encounter for him is dated July 31, 2019.

persons.name: MLP
persons.context: The healthcare provider (Mid-Level Provider) who conducted the clinical encounter with Jeffrey Epstein on July 23, 2019, at 06:20, documenting his injuries and assessment.

persons.name: PA-C
persons.context: The healthcare provider who conducted a clinical encounter with inmate Nicholas Tartaglione on July 31, 2019.

persons.name: Lieutenant
persons.context: A correctional lieutenant who took photographs of the incident scene and the involved inmates (Epstein and Tartaglione) on July 23, 2019, starting at 1:45 AM.

connections.description: Were housed together in the same cell (Z05-124LAD) in the Special Housing Unit (SHU).
Epstein alleged that Tartaglione tried to kill him and had been attempting to extort money from him, threatening to beat him up.
Epstein communicated his allegations against Tartaglione to Officer P, who then reported them to a lieutenant.
Were housed together in Special Housing Unit cell 124 at the Metropolitan Correctional Center. Tartaglione was present when Epstein was found with a rope around his neck.
MLP provided medical assessment and treatment to Epstein following the incident in his cell on July 23, 2019.
PA-C conducted a clinical encounter with Tartaglione on July 31, 2019, following the incident involving his cellmate.
The lieutenant, as a correctional supervisor, was involved in the official documentation (photo sheets) of the incident involving Epstein.

events.title: Epstein Found with Noose in Cell
events.description: At approximately 1:27 AM, correctional officers responded to a call for assistance in the Special Housing Unit. They found inmate Jeffrey Epstein on the floor of his cell (Z05-124LAD) with an orange homemade cloth around his neck. He was breathing but unresponsive initially.

events.title: Epstein's Allegations Against Cellmate
events.description: After being moved to a suicide watch unit, Epstein became responsive and told Officer P that his cellmate, Nicholas Tartaglione, had tried to kill him and had been attempting to extort money from him for a week, threatening violence.

events.title: Tartaglione's Account of Discovery
events.description: Tartaglione stated he was asleep when he felt something hit his legs. He turned on the light and saw Epstein with a string around his neck, after which he called for the guards.

events.title: Medical Examination
events.description: Epstein was later examined by medical staff (MLP) and found to have a circular line of erythema (redness) at the base of his neck with friction marks, and a small erythema on his left knee.

events.title: Epstein Found Unresponsive in Cell
events.description: At approximately 1:27 AM, correctional staff found inmate Jeffrey Epstein in SHU cell 124 with an orange homemade rope around his neck. He was breathing but unresponsive. His cellmate, Nicholas Tartaglione, was at the cell door. Staff removed the rope and Epstein from the cell.

events.title: Medical Assessment of Epstein
events.description: At 06:20, MLP examined Epstein following the incident. Epstein claimed he did not know what happened, had a circular line of erythema on his neck, and was smiling during the exam. He was placed on suicide watch.

events.title: Incident Documentation and Photography
events.description: Starting at 1:45 AM, a lieutenant took multiple photographs of the incident scene (SHU cell 124) and of both inmates Epstein and Tartaglione as part of the Special Investigative Section's report on a 'Possible Suicide Attempt'.

events.title: Epstein Placed in Administrative Detention
events.description: An order was issued to place Jeffrey Epstein in Administrative Detention in the Special Housing Unit, citing 'pending classification' and that his presence in general population posed a threat.

events.title: Medical Encounter for Tartaglione
events.description: PA-C conducted a clinical encounter with inmate Nicholas Tartaglione, presumably for evaluation following the incident with his cellmate.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
Special Housing Unit (SHU), 9 SOUTH SHU, M Tier, Cell Z05-124LAD (also noted as 205-124)
HA-Unit (likely Health Services or Holding Area)
Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), New York, N.Y.
NYM (presumably New York Metropolitan correctional facility)
keyFacts: On July 23, 2019, at 1:27 AM, Jeffrey Epstein was found in his prison cell with an orange homemade cloth around his neck, in an incident initially documented as a suicide attempt.
Epstein later alleged that his cellmate, Nicholas Tartaglione, had tried to kill him and had been extorting him, claiming Tartaglione said staff would not report a beating due to Epstein's charges.
Tartaglione's account contradicted Epstein's, stating he discovered Epstein with the noose and immediately called for guards.
The incident report notes observing Epstein flicker his eyes and appear to pretend to be unconscious when staff made eye contact with him while moving him on a stretcher.
The document is a confidential Bureau of Prisons Form 583, marked as law enforcement sensitive and not for public release.
Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell at approximately 1:27 AM on July 23, 2019, with an orange homemade rope around his neck, breathing but unresponsive.
The official Bureau of Prisons Incident Report classifies the event under prohibited act code 228 as 'Self-Mutilation'.

Epstein's medical assessment notes he was 'smiling during this clinical encounter', claimed he did not know what happened, and could not explain the marks on his neck, which included a circular line of erythema.
Epstein's cellmate at the time was Nicholas Tartaglione, who was secured and removed from the cell by staff when they responded.
Epstein had been placed in Administrative Detention in the Special Housing Unit on July 10, 2019, for 'pending classification' and security reasons.
